p: A. daniellii, also known as ‘African cardamom’, is an herbaceous plant traditionally used in Africa as a spice due to the pungent taste of its seeds, whereas, for medicinal purposes, the plant is employed as a laxative and for curing parasitic and other microbial infections [ 25, 26]. The anti-inflammatory effect of its seed essential oil and the preservative properties in stored grains have also been reported [ 27, 28].
